00079 #include "AssociationFramework.hpp"

00087 using namespace ears;

00091 void info() {
00092   std::cerr 
00093     << "Entity and Association Retrieval System (EARS) v1.0 (2009-12-04)" << std::endl
00094     << "Copyright (c) 2009, Krisztian Balog. All rights reserved." << std::endl 
00095     << std::endl;
00096 }
00097 
00098 
00100 void usage() {
00101   std::cerr << "USAGE: ears <command> <paramfile> [debug_level]" << std::endl
00102     << std::endl
00103     << "  Command:   Description:" << std::endl
00104     << "  --------   ------------" << std::endl
00105     << "  ef         entity finding" << std::endl
00106     << "  ep         entity profiling" << std::endl
00107     << std::endl
00108     << "  Debug levels: error, warning, info (default), debug, debugall" 
00109     << std::endl
00110     << std::endl;
00111 }
00112 
00113 
00114 
00116 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00117 
00118   info();
00119   
00120   if (argc < 3) {
00121     usage();
00122     return -1;
00123   }
00124   
00125   try {    
00126     // log level
00127     ears::EARSLog::reportingLevel() = ears::EARSLog::fromString( argv[3] ? argv[3] : "info" );
00128     
00129     if ( lemur::api::ParamPushFile( argv[2] ) ) {      
00130       ears::AssociationFramework* framework = new ears::AssociationFramework();      
00131       framework->run( argv[1] );      
00132       delete framework;
00133     }
00134     else {
00135       LOG( ears::logERROR ) << "invalid parameter file";
00136     }
00137   }
00138   catch ( const std::exception& e ) {
00139     LOG( ears::logERROR ) << e.what();
00140   }
00141       
00142         return 0;
00143 }
